symptoms: sneezing runny nose red itchy watery eyes wheezing coughing rash asthema eczema
treatment: antihistamines decongestants lotion and creams steroid apray drop cream inhalers for saftey please get professional advice from your Doctor

symptoms: feeling sick weight loss loss of appetite yellowing of the eyes and skin jaundice swelling in the ankles and tummy confusion or drowsiness vomiting blood or passing blood in your stools
treatment: There's currently no specific medical treatment for ARLD. The main treatment is to stop drinking, preferably for the rest of your life. This reduces the risk of further damage to your liver and gives it the best chance of recovering. A liver transplant may be required in severe cases where the liver has stopped functioning and doesn't improve when you stop drinking alcohol.

symptoms: pain in the middle of your tummy abdomen that come and go lose your appetite
treatment: In most cases of appendicitis, the appendix needs to be surgically removed as soon as possible.

symptoms: joint pain tenderness and stiffness inflammation in and around the joints restricted movement of the joints warm red skin over the affected joint weakness and muscle wasting
treatment: There's no cure for arthritis, but there are many treatments that can help slow down the condition. painkillers arthroplasty (joint replacement) arthodesis (joint fusion)

symptoms: depression feeling very low and feeling very high and overactive simple mood swings
treatment: medication to treat the main symptoms of depression and mania when they occur psychological treatment such as talking therapy, which can help you deal with depression, and provides advice about how to improve your relationships

symptoms: persistent bone pain that gets worse over time and continues into the night swelling and redness inflammation over a bone make movement joint difficult noticeable lump over a bone weak bone that breaks fractures more easily than normal
treatment: surgery to remove the section of cancerous bone – it's often possible to reconstruct or replace the bone that's been removed, but amputation is sometimes necessary chemotherapy – treatment with powerful cancer-killing medication radiotherapy – where radiation is used to destroy cancerous cells

symptoms: change in the size or shape of  breasts discharge from either of your nipples streaked with blood a rash on or around your nipple change in the appearance of your nipple
treatment: Breast cancer is treated using a combination of surgery, chemotherapy and radiotherapy. Surgery is usually the first type of treatment you'll have, followed by chemotherapy or radiotherapy or, in some cases, hormone or biological treatments.

symptoms: persistent cough brings phlegm sputum breathlessness
treatment: exercises and special devices to help you clear mucus out of your lungs. medication to help improve airflow wit the lungs. antibiotics to treat any lung infecti that develop

symptoms: sore throat blocked or runny nose sneezing cough headache
treatment:
esting, drinking plenty of fluids and eating healthily. taking over-the-counter painkillers, such as paracetamol or ibuprofen, to reduce any fever or discomfort.using decongestant sprays or tablets to relieve a blocked nose.trying remedies such as gargling salt water and sucking on menthol sweets.
 if your symptoms persist for more than three weeks please seek for professional advise

symptoms: stomach ache and cramps feeling bloated feeling sick loss of appetite gas
treatment: Diet and lifestyle changes are usually recommended as the first treatment for constipation.This includes gradually increasing your daily intake of fibre, making sure you drink plenty of fluids, and trying to get more exercise.If these aren't effective, your pharmacist may recommend an oral laxative medication that can help you empty your bowels.

symptoms: fever dry cough tiredness aches and pains sore throat diarrhoea conjunctivitis headache loss of taste or smell a rash on skin, or discolouration of fingers or toes difficulty breathing or shortness of breath chest pain or pressure loss of speech or movement
treatment:
Isolate yourself in a well ventilated room.Use a triple layer medical mask, discard mask after 8 hours of use or earlier if they become wet or visibly soiled. In the event of a caregiver entering the room, both caregiver and patient may consider using N 95 mask.Take rest and drink a lot of fluids to maintain adequate hydration.Frequent hand washing with soap and water for at least 40 seconds or clean with alcohol-based sanitizer.

 take prescribed doses of vaccine.

 STAY HOME, STAY SAFE

symptoms: a high temperature tiredness and weakness a headache general aches and pains a dry chesty cough
treatment: Antiviral medication, Antibiotics If you feel unwell and have a fever, you can take paracetamol or anti-inflammatory medicines such as ibuprofen  lower your temperature and relieve aches. Children under 16 shouldn't be given aspirin

symptoms: Breathlessness Tiredness and lethargy Leg swelling Loss of appetite cough and a frothy spit
treatment: cpr can help to save the life, call the ambulance as soon as possible.

symptoms: severe pain in the abdomen  urinary tract infection ache in the lower back periods of intense pain in the back or side of your abdomen feeling restless and unable to lie still nausea needing to urinate more often than normal pain when you urinate blood in your urine
treatment: Larger stones may need to be broken up using ultrasound or laser energy. Occasionally, keyhole surgery may be needed to remove very large kidney stones directly.visit your Doctor for more info and treatment.

symptoms: unexplained weight loss loss of appetite feeling very full after eating even if the meal was small feeling sick and vomiting pain or swelling in your abdomen jaundice itchy skin feeling very tired and weak
treatment: Liver cancer is usually diagnosed after a consultation with a GP and a referral to a hospital specialist for further tests, such as scans of your liver.However, regular check-ups for liver cancer (known as surveillance) are often recommended for people known to have a high risk of developing the condition, such as those with cirrhosis.

symptoms: a persistent cough coughing up blood persistent breathlessness unexplained tiredness and weight loss an ache or pain when breathing or coughing
treatment: Treatment depends on the type of cancer, how far it's spread and how good your general health is. If thezzx condition is diagnosed early and the cancerous cells are confined to a small area, surgery to remove the affected area of lung is usually recommended.If surgery is unsuitable due to your general health, radiotherapy to destroy the cancerous cells may be recommended instead.If the cancer has spread too far for surgery or radiotherapy to be effective, chemotherapy is usually used.

symptoms: blood in your urine a constant pain in your side just below the ribs a lump or swelling in the kidney area
treatment: Nephrectomy,Embolisation,Radiotherapy,Cryotherapy,

symptoms: pain and discomfort in your side lower back or around your genitals high temperature it may reach 39.5C or 103.1F shivering or chills feeling very weak or tired loss of appetite feeling sick or being sick

symptoms: a high temperature fever headache sweats chills vomiting muscle pains diarrhoea generally feeling unwell

symptoms: persistent pain in the mouth pain or difficulty when swallowing dysphagia changes in your voice or speech problems swollen lymph nodes glands in your neck unexplained weight loss bleeding or numbness in the mouth a tooth or teeth that becomes loose for no obvious reason difficulty moving your jaw
treatment: Surgery Photodynamic therapy (PDT),Other forms of surgery,Radiotherapy,Internal radiotherapy,Chemotherapy,Cetuximab

symptoms: pain or numbness in the face swollen glands in the neck partial loss of vision or double vision a bulging or persistently watering eye a lump or growth on your face  nose or roof of your mouth a persistent blocked nose which usually only affects one side nosebleeds mucus draining from the nose which may be blood-stained a decreased sense of smell
treatment: surgery to remove a tumour,radiotherapy,chemotherapy

symptoms: continous nose bleeding
treatment: sit down and firmly pinch the soft part of your nose just above your nostril for at least 10-15 minutes,lean forward and breathe through your mouth – this will drain blood into your nose instead of down the back of your throat,place an ice pack or bag of frozen vegetables covered by a towel on the bridge of your nose,stay upright rather than lying down as this reduces the blood pressure in the blood vessels of your nose and will discourage further bleeding

symptoms: difficulty in sleeping back or joint pain excessive sweating intolerance to heat infections in skin folds fatigue depression
treatment: exercise on prescription,diet,medication

symptoms: increased abdominal size and persistent bloating not bloating that comes and goes persistent pelvic and abdominal pain difficulty eating and feeling full quickly or feeling nauseou
treatment: surgery,chemotherapy,radiotherapy,psychological help

symptoms: persistent indigestion or heartburn bringing up food soon after eating loss of appetite and weight loss,persistent vomiting pain or discomfort in your upper tummy chest or back a persistent cough hoarseness tiredness shortness of breath and pale skin vomiting blood or coughing up blood although this is uncommon
treatment: surgery,chemotherapy,radiotherapy

symptoms: white patches plaques in the mouth that can often be wiped off leaving behind red areas that may bleed slightly loss of taste or an unpleasant taste in the mouth redness inside the mouth and throat cracks at the corners of the mouth a painful burning sensation in the mouth
treatment: antifungal medicines

symptoms: the exocrine pancreas produces digestive enzymes which break down food so they can be absorbed by your body the endocrine pancreas produces hormones including insulin which keeps your blood sugar levels stable pain in the stomach or back jaundice weight loss
treatment: surgery,chemotherapy,radiotherapy

symptoms: a sensation that your heart is beating irregularly palpitations sweating trembling hot flushes chills shortness of breath a choking sensation chest pain nausea dizziness feeling faint numbness or pins and needles dry mouth a need to go to the toilet ringing in your ears a feeling of dread or a fear of dying a churning stomach a tingling sensation in your fingers shivering shaking
treatment: cognitive behavioural therapy,support groups,antidepressants,selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs)

symptoms: lack of concern regret or remorse about other people's distress irresponsibility and disregard for normal social behaviour difficulty in sustaining long-term relationships little ability to tolerate frustration and to control their anger lack of guilt or not learning from their mistakes blaming others for problems in their lives
treatment: psychological therapie,psychodynamic reflective psychotherapy cognitive behavioural therapy interpersonal therapy therapeutic communities medication

symptoms: getting bigger changing shape changing colour bleeding or becoming crusty itchy or painful

symptoms: persistent indigestion trapped wind and frequent burping heartburn feeling full very quickly when eating feeling bloated after eating feeling sick pain in your stomach or breastbone difficulty swallowing  dysphagia vomiting  the vomit may be streaked with blood although this is uncommon in the early stages
treatment: trastuzumab,radiotherapy,chemotherapy,surgery

symptoms: skin damage by uv rays blistering or swelling of the skin oedema chills a high temperature fever of 38C 100.4F or above or 37.5C 99.5F or above in children under five dizziness headaches and feeling sick symptoms of heat exhaustion
treatment: suitable clothing,sunscreen

symptoms: lack of appetite and weight loss a high temperature fever night sweats extreme tiredness or fatigue
treatment: two antibiotics isoniazid and rifampicin for six months two additional antibiotics pyrazinamide and ethambutol for the first two months

symptoms: toothache either continuous pain keeping you awake or occasional sharp pain without an obvious cause tooth sensitivity you may feel tenderness or pain when eating or drinking something hot cold or sweet grey brown or black spots appearing on your teeth bad breath an unpleasant taste in your mouth
treatment: visit your dentist regularly ,cut down on sugary and starchy food and drinks, particularly between meals or within an hour of going to bed,look after your teeth and gums,avoid smoking or drinking alcohol excessively ,see your dentist or GP if you have a persistently dry mouth

symptoms: high temperature fever over 38C 100.4F coughing headache earache feeling sick feeling tired swollen painful lymph glands in your neck loss of voice or changes to your voice
treatment: self-help,antibiotics,surgery,post-operative bleeding

symptoms: unexplained hoarseness that doesn't get better after a few weeks a sore throat or difficulty swallowing that doesn't get better pain in your neck
treatment: a surgeon an endocrinologist a specialist in treating hormonal conditions an oncologist a cancer treatment specialist a pathologist a specialist in diseased tissue a radiotherapist or clinical oncologist a specialist in non-surgical methods of treating cancer such as chemotherapy and radiotherapy a specialist cancer nurse who will usually be your first point of contact with the rest of the team

symptoms: diarrhoea vomiting In some cases thirst may be caused by something as simple as a recent meal or snack Eating salty or spicy foods can cause you to suddenly feel thirsty
treatment: If you feel thirsty all the time and have other symptoms, your GP will probably carry out a blood glucose test to see whether you have diabetes.

symptoms: lack of appetite and weight loss a high temperature fever night sweats extreme tiredness or fatigue
treatment: Treatment for tuberculosis (TB) will usually involve a long course of antibiotics lasting several months.

symptoms: grey brown or black spots appearing on your teeth bad breath an unpleasant taste in your mouth
swelling at the front of the neck a sore throat or difficulty swallowing that doesn't get better pain in your neck
treatment: all NHS hospitals have multidisciplinary teams MDTs that treat thyroid cancer.

symptoms: sore throat tonsils will be red and swollen and your throat may be very painful making swallowing difficult high temperature (fever) over 38C (100.4F) coughing headache earache feeling sick
treatment: Over the counter painkillers, such as paracetamol and ibuprofen, can help relieve painful symptoms such as a sore throat.

symptoms: swelling in one of your testicles size of a pea may be larger dull ache or sharp pain in your testicles or scrotum which may come and go feeling of heaviness in your scrotum
treatment: Chemotherapy, radiotherapy and surgery are the 3 main treatments for testicular cancer.

symptoms: intense itching around the anus and the vagina in girls
treatment: Mebendazole is the main medication used to treat threadworm infections

symptoms: itching soreness and redness or fissures like paper cuts around the vagina or anus unusual white discharge from the vagina that may be thick and look like cottage cheese it sometimes smells yeasty pain when peeing or having sex
treatment: antifungal cream to apply to the genital area, vaginal pessaries (tablets that you put into your vagina), oral pills or a combination.

symptoms: buzzing humming grinding hissing whistling
treatment: sound therapy,counselling,cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT),tinnitus retraining therapy (TRT)

symptoms: pain or a burning sensation when peeing itching and soreness in the genital area a yellow or green discharge from the vagina or penis which can sometimes have an unpleasant fishy smell
treatment: Antibiotics will get rid of the infection.

symptoms: recurring diarrhoea which may contain blood mucus or pus abdominal pain needing to empty your bowels frequently
treatment: medication such as: aminosalicylates (ASAs), corticosteroids,immunosuppressants

symptoms: tiredness being sensitive to cold weight gain constipation depression slow movements and thoughts muscle aches and weakness muscle cramps dry and scaly skin brittle hair and nails irregular periods or heavy periods
treatment: treated by taking daily hormone replacement tablets called levothyroxine.

symptoms: itchy rash that appears on the skin It may appear on one part of the body or be spread across large areas.
treatment: If the itchiness is causing you discomfort antihistamines can help

symptoms: high temperature fever of 38C 100.4ºF or above pain in your sides or back shivering and chills feeling and being sick confusion agitation or restlessness
treatment: Over-the-counter painkillers such as paracetamol can help with any pain. Drinking plenty of fluids may also help you feel better.

symptoms: bleeding between your normal periods or after sex bleeding after the menopause post-menopausal bleeding blood in your urine pelvic pain an itch or lump in your vagina

symptoms: itching and soreness around the entrance of the vagina itchy labia pain during sex which may make you worry about having sex a stinging sensation when peeing
treatment: Thrush is treated with antifungal medicines that are available as pessaries intravaginal creams or capsules.

symptoms: itchy red and swollen dry and flaky scaly or crusty
treatment: long-term treatment with a combination of: emollients (moisturisers),topical corticosteroids,compression stockings

symptoms: aching heavy and uncomfortable legs swollen feet and ankles burning or throbbing in your legs muscle cramp in your legs particularly at night dry itchy and thin skin over the affected vein
treatment: taking regular exercise, avoiding standing up for long periods, elevating the affected area when resting

symptoms: a heavy feeling in your legs swollen ankles oedema aching or swelling in your legs red flaky scaly and itchy skin on your legs varicose eczema swollen and enlarged veins on your legs varicose veins an unpleasant and foul smelling discharge from the ulcer
treatment: Treatment should always be carried out by a healthcare professional trained in compression therapy for leg ulcers.

symptoms: loss of balance which can make it difficult to stand or walk feeling sick or being sick dizziness
treatment: Medicines such as prochlorperazine and some antihistamines

symptoms: a persistent itch in the vulva an open sore in the vulva a burning pain when passing urine a mole on the vulva that changes shape or colour pain soreness or tenderness in the vulva

symptoms: Warts are not usually painful but some types such as verrucas may hurt They can occasionally itch or bleed

symptoms: runny nose red and watery eyes a sore throat and a slightly raised temperature.
treatment: drink lots of fluids clean away mucus and sick from your or your child's mouth and take painkillers such as paracetamol or ibuprofen for a fever.
